subject: Investing
title: What Owning a Stock Really Means
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: What Owning a Stock Really Means.

hook.text: Buy one share of Apple and you literally own a piece of the company. A tiny piece, but real.

buildup.text: A stock is a certificate of ownership. Each share represents a fraction of the company's total value.

discovery.text: Apple has about 15 billion shares. One share makes you a 0.000000007% owner. Small, but legally real.

twist.text: Owning stock doesn't mean you can walk into Apple HQ and sit down. Ownership gives rights, not access.

climax.text: Those rights include voting on company decisions and receiving dividends when profits are shared.

punchline.text: A stock is not a lottery ticket. It's a deed to a business.

quiz.question: What does owning a share of stock represent?
